alert.note: Alert for Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 23 at 4:29PM EDT until May 23 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR ORANGE COUNTY... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. While the heaviest rain has moved out of the area, additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are still possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Durham, Chapel Hill, Hillsborough, Carrboro, Mebane, Efland, Schley, Eno River State Park and Cane Creek Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
